titles: A proclamation, whereas our dearest brother of blessed memory, by his royal proclamation bearing date the fifteenth day of September, in the twelfth year of his reign, for preventing the exportation of wool James. R.
author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.
publisher: Printed by Charles Bill, Henry Hills, and Thomas Newcomb ...,
notes: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
At head of title: By the King, a proclamation.
At end of text: Given at our court at Windsor the eleventh day of July 1687.
keywords: Wool industry --  Great Britain --  Early works to 1800.
